org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules

Class Counter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules.AbstractModule
      • org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules.Loop
        • org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules.Counter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Identifiable, Versionable, Module

    public class Counter
extends Loop
    The Counter class repeats the module's functionality until a numeric limit is reached or (if canAbort flag is set) until the module finished successfully.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.panthercode.arctic.core.processing.modules.Loop

        public Counter(Module module,
               int count,
               long delayTimeInMillis,
               boolean canAbort,
               boolean ignoreExceptions)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        module - module to processing
        count - maximal counts of repeats
        delayTimeInMillis - timeout after each round
        canAbort - flag to abort the process before count is reached
        ignoreExceptions - ignore exceptions are thrown by module

      • actualCount

        public int actualCount()
        Returns the number repeats have done until starting the process.
        Returns:
        Returns the actual number of repeats have done or zero if process state is not "Running".

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Begin to repeat the modules start() method until the count limit is reached or (if set) the module finished successfully. Before repeating the before() is called. After finishing the after() method is called.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Module
        Overrides:
        start in class AbstractModule
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Is thrown if an exception is thrown by module and flag ignoreExceptions is false.
